The Ohio Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services (MHAS) announced the launch of a new mental health COVID CareLine for Ohioans.

The CareLine (1-800-720-9616) is a toll-free, confidential, emotional support call service staffed by behavioral health professionals. The CareLine operates from 8:00 AM - 8:00 PM, 7 days/week. They will offer confidential support in times of personal crisis when individuals may be struggling to cope with current challenges in their lives. After 8:00 PM, the CareLine will forward to the National Suicide Prevention Helpline, allowing those calling to have access to someone 24 hours/day.

Again, the Black River family sends its deepest and heartfelt condolences to Jacob’s family and friends.

On October 7, the Black River FFA Chapter hosted their annual Farm Games event. In addition to the Black River FFA, also in attendance were FFA members from the Loudonville FFA Chapter. However, in the end it was the Black River FFA chapter that took home the gold!

The committee planned activities that encouraged fellow FFA members to use team working and leadership skills. In addition, to the leadership activities, members also participated in a variety of games, such as musical tailgates, bale toss, needle in a haystack, the sponge game, tug-a-war, a three-legged sack race, wheelbarrow relay race, corn hole, pumpkin carving and an ice cream eating contest. All members in attendance had a great time interacting with other local chapter members and making new friends.
